org.placeName: Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT OF THE WESTERN DISTRIT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF CHARLES M. HELMORE FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS. PETITION. NO. 3385
Comes now your petitioner, Charles M. Helmore, by his attorneys Welch and Dore, and respectfully shows to this Court:

l. That at the present times and since March 31, 1916, he has been detained of his liberty and confined in the County Jail in Tacoma, Wash. by John Boyle, U.S. Marshall, for the Western District of Washington.

ll. That said Boyle is holding him in custody under a commitment issued out of this court on March 31, 1916. Said commitment being based upon a void judgment in the U.S. District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division; said judgment reciting that your petitioner was convicted on the offense of having in his possession opium and cocaine.

lll. Said judgment does not recite that your petitioner was guilty of any other offense, and aid void judgment recites that your petitioner shall be confined for a period of six months in the Pierce County Jail, and said judgment and the whole there of, is void and invalid, and your petitioner's detention by reason of said void and invalid judgment, is illegal and unwarranted in law.

WHEREFORE your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue under the seal of this court, directed to said John Boyle, to produce your petitioner before this Court, and show what cause, if any, he has, for the detention of
your petitioner and that your petitioner be discharged.
ATTORNEYS FOR PETITIONER, CHARLES M. HELMORE.
